cards.title: Audit Finding
cards.description: Internal audit found critical compliance gaps. They're demanding immediate action.

cards.title: Key Person Quits
cards.description: Your most critical team member just handed in their resignation. They have unique knowledge.

cards.title: Production Outage
cards.description: A critical production system is down. Revenue is being impacted every minute.

cards.title: Holiday Party Incident
cards.description: The VP of Sales got extremely drunk at the company holiday party and made inappropriate comments to several employees. Someone recorded it on their phone.

cards.title: Viral Karaoke Disaster
cards.description: The CFO's enthusiastic but deeply unfortunate karaoke performance at the team offsite has gone viral on TikTok. The hashtag #CorporateCringe is trending.

choices.text: Hire a PR firm to spin it as 'authentic leadership'

cards.title: Intern Dropped Production Database
cards.description: The summer intern was given production access 'to learn' and accidentally ran DROP DATABASE. The backups haven't been tested in 8 months.

choices.text: Fire the intern, claim it was malicious

cards.title: Catastrophic Reply-All
cards.description: A mid-level manager accidentally sent a brutally honest email about layoff plans to the entire company. The email included the phrase 'dead weight employees' and a list of names.

cards.title: Questionable Executive Expenses
cards.description: Finance flagged the VP of Marketing's expense report: $47,000 at a Vegas 'team building' event, including $8,000 for 'client entertainment' at an establishment whose name ends in 'Gentlemen's Club.'

cards.title: Board Presentation Disaster
cards.description: The Director of Strategy just presented last year's numbers to the board instead of this year's. They're asking why revenue 'went backwards.' The director is sweating visibly.

choices.text: Throw the director under the bus

cards.title: VP Announces Unauthorized Partnership
cards.description: The VP of Business Development just announced a major partnership with a competitor on LinkedIn. Legal wasn't consulted. The board wasn't told. The partner company has no idea what she's talking about.

choices.text: Scramble to actually close the deal

cards.title: Salary Data Leaked
cards.description: Someone posted a spreadsheet with everyone's salaries to the company Slack. The pay disparities are... significant. Several employees are demanding explanations.

choices.text: Launch investigation to find the leaker

cards.title: Leadership Offsite Food Poisoning
cards.description: The entire executive team got food poisoning at the leadership offsite. Half of them are in the hospital. The company has no succession plan and a board meeting tomorrow.

choices.text: Prop them up on Zoom, claim 'connection issues'

cards.title: Automated Email Gone Wrong
cards.description: The marketing team's 'personalized' email campaign has a bug. It sent 50,000 customers an email starting with 'Dear [CUSTOMER_NAME], your order of [PRODUCT_NAME] will arrive [ERROR_NULL_REFERENCE]...'

choices.text: Claim it was a phishing test

cards.title: Customer Service Bot Malfunction
cards.description: The new AI customer service bot has started telling customers to 'seek professional help' and 'consider their life choices' when they complain. Screenshots are everywhere.

choices.text: Hire crisis PR to make it a 'viral moment'
Double down - the bot has a point

cards.title: Corporate Social Media Compromised
cards.description: The company Twitter account posted 'We hate our customers almost as much as we hate working here.' Social media manager claims they were 'hacked' but IT can't find evidence of intrusion.

choices.text: Hire comedy writers for humorous response

cards.title: Product Demo Goes Catastrophically Wrong
cards.description: The big product launch demo just crashed live on stage. The engineering VP muttered 'works on my machine' loudly enough for the front row to hear. Investors are present.

cards.title: Office Comfort Animal Incident
cards.description: The 'office comfort animal' policy has backfired. Someone brought an emotional support peacock that attacked the CFO. Legal is asking who approved this policy.

choices.text: Pay for CFO's 'recovery retreat' and peacock rehoming
Ban all animals, issue formal policy

cards.title: Executive Crypto Scheme Exposed
cards.description: The Head of Innovation has been mining cryptocurrency on company servers. IT noticed when the electricity bill tripled. He's asking if this can be written off as 'R&D.'

cards.title: Glassdoor Meltdown
cards.description: A viral Glassdoor review describes your company as 'a dumpster fire managed by raccoons.' It has 847 'helpful' votes and counting. The CEO is named specifically.

choices.text: Flood Glassdoor with fake positive reviews

cards.title: Discrimination Lawsuit Filed
cards.description: A former employee has filed a discrimination lawsuit. Their lawyer has emails. Lots of emails. Several are from people still in leadership.

choices.text: Launch PR campaign against the plaintiff

cards.title: Mass Poaching Attempt
cards.description: Your main competitor has made offers to your entire engineering team. They're offering 40% raises and unlimited PTO. Half the team is already in final rounds.

cards.title: Customer Data Breach
cards.description: Hackers got in through a vendor's system. They have customer names, emails, and passwords. The security team knew about the vulnerability but 'deprioritized' the fix.

choices.text: Immediate full disclosure and free credit monitoring

cards.title: Unionization Effort
cards.description: Word has leaked that employees are organizing a union. Someone found authorization cards in the break room printer. The board is demanding 'action.'

cards.title: Executive Relationship Scandal
cards.description: The CTO and VP of HR have been having an affair. It's now public knowledge because they were caught in the supply closet. They both report to you.

choices.text: Transfer one to a different department
Ignore it - their personal lives aren't our business

cards.title: Product Safety Recall
cards.description: Quality discovered a safety issue in a product that shipped to 100,000 customers. Engineering knew about it but classified it as 'edge case.' Two customers were injured.

choices.text: Quiet recall to reported affected units only

cards.title: Founder Public Meltdown
cards.description: The company founder (who still sits on the board) went on a podcast and called your strategy 'idiotic' and your leadership 'the B-team.' The clip is trending.

cards.title: Environmental Violation Discovered
cards.description: An internal audit found we've been disposing of e-waste illegally for 3 years. The vendor we hired was just dumping it in a vacant lot. Regulators haven't noticed yet.

choices.text: Fix the process, hope no one notices
Claim no knowledge, blame the vendor

cards.title: Team Burnout Emergency
cards.description: Three senior engineers were hospitalized with stress-related illness in the same week. Their manager's Slack message history shows them demanding 80-hour weeks. The story is on Hacker News.

choices.text: Deny any pressure, call it 'isolated incidents'

cards.title: Investor Due Diligence Leak
cards.description: A potential acquirer's due diligence team leaked your financials to a tech blog. Everyone now knows your burn rate and that runway is shorter than the press releases claimed.

cards.title: Meeting Culture Rebellion
cards.description: Someone posted the company's average meeting load (32 hours/week per employee) on Twitter. The engineering team has declared 'Meeting Bankruptcy' and is refusing all non-essential meetings.
